The President as Commander-in-Chief has broad authority to act to keep the people of this country safe.  

The plague of domestic terrorism and racist hatred fueled by the likes of Tucker Carlson and Donald Trump has got to be stopped now.  

We need zero tolerance for hate.

4/4

The radically unrepresentative Senate, with the anti-democratic filibuster decision rule making the gridlock even worse, has failed for decades to do anything serious to curtail gun violence.  

It needs to be reformed, but we cannot wait for that. 

The President must act. 

3/4

The President should examine the possibility of declaring a national emergency to address the epidemic of gun violence. 

Yes, there are still limits on what can be done — but how would we expect the President to act if these were acts of foreign terrorism? 

2/4

I know the Biden Administration and others before it have looked at what the President has the legal authority to do to curtail the gun violence in our country. 

But we have to look harder.

We need to find the means to protect our children from this ongoing evil. 

1/4 https://t.co/yazAAZM8DQ
